title: 10.10 Kernel update black screen flash and no mouse

sentences.text: After the recent update to the kernel in 10 .10 I noticed that some times my screen will flash black..
and then the mouse cursor disappears.
I am no wiz in here..
so can't give a great deal of info on my system.
But the bug fixes for such as this stopped last year.
I can reboot and find  the mouse again..
and I can move the mouse around and find stuff , like using a tab key would be ..
but you can not see the mouse.
tool bars end up with multi slurred colors pix-elated.
a reboot and that is all better.
I am not one who knows how to update logs or find boot logs or the like..
but if there is a beginner description on how to fix this..
AlsaVersion: Advanced Linux Sound Architecture Driver Version 1.0.23.
CRDA: Error: [Errno 2] No such file or directory
Card hw:0 'V8237'/'VIA 8237 with ALC655 at 0xb000, irq 22'
Would it be possible for you to test the latest upstream kernel?
It will allow additional upstream developers to examine the issue.
If possible, please test the latest kernel (Not a kernel in the daily directory).
Once you've tested the upstream kernel, please remove the 'needs-upstream-testing' tag(Only that one tag, please leave the others).
This can be done by clicking on the yellow pencil icon next to the tag located at the bottom of the bug description and deleting the 'needs-upstream-testing' text.
If this bug is fixed by the mainline kernel, please add the following tag 'kernel-fixed-upstream-KERNEL-VERSION'.
For example, if kernel version 3.1-rc9 fixed and issue, the tag would be: 'kernel-fixed-upstream-v3.1-rc9'.
If the mainline kernel does not fix this bug, please add the tag: 'kernel-bug-exists-upstream'.
Would that upstream kernel also have ext3 boot support back in?
I filed a bug yesterday about that, though have seen no one move that bug from it's initial reported state.
With this same kernel I see the ext3 boot partition not recognized.
If testing the upstream kernel might deal with that issue, I can test here also.
this is probably much easier than it sounds.
what I am trying to figure out here is when I click on your Wiki link..
below in the page there is :
We currently build five sets of mainline kernels.
All formal tags from Linus' tree and from the stable trees, plus:
the tip of the master branch from Linus'
the tip of the master branch of the debloat-testing tree daily,    5.
This makes these kernels closer to the Lucid kernels which are based on
2.6.32 kernels with DRM backported from the 2.6.33 series.
I am assuming the above is Daily Directory ?
where is this Latest kernel found ?
I see much below that a way to down load and install various types of kernel and how to install them.
Not sure exactly how to do all that as I am such a new be on much of that.
I have very light Terminal understanding.
as in Sudo apt- get install etc..
Not much more training than that..
Wish there were an easy game or class to take for more.
can some one be so kind as to be patient and help a guy Do what is best with this?
IE Show me a little more on HOW to do what you are asking?
I am sure I will - hand to face- this once I realize how easy it is.
On Thu, Oct 27, 2011 at 9:00 AM, Joseph Salisbury <
> Would it be possible for you to test the latest upstream kernel?
It > will allow additional upstream developers to examine the issue.
> the latest kernel (Not a kernel in the daily directory).
Once you've > tested the upstream kernel, please remove the 'needs-upstream-testing' > tag(Only that one tag, please leave the others).
This can be done by > clicking on the yellow pencil icon next to the tag located at the bottom > of the bug description and deleting the 'needs-upstream-testing' text.
> If this bug is fixed by the mainline kernel, please add the following > tag 'kernel-fixed-upstream-KERNEL-VERSION'.
> version 3.1-rc9 fixed and issue, the tag would be: 'kernel-fixed- > upstream-v3.1-rc9'.
> If the mainline kernel does not fix this bug, please add the tag:
> You received this bug notification because you are subscribed to the bug > report.
>  10.10 Kernel update black screen flash and no mouse
> Status in linux package in Ubuntu:
>  After the recent update to the kernel in 10 .10 I noticed that some times > my screen will flash black..
and then the mouse cursor disappears.
I am no > wiz in here..
so can't give a great deal of info on my system.
But the bug > fixes for such as this stopped last year.
>  I can reboot and find  the mouse again..
and I can move the mouse around > and find stuff , like using a tab key would be ..
but you can not see the > mouse.
tool bars end up with multi slurred > colors pix-elated.
a reboot and that is all better.
>  I am not one who knows how to update logs or find boot logs or the like..
> but if there is a beginner description on how to fix this..
>  AlsaVersion: Advanced Linux Sound Architecture Driver Version 1.0.23.
>  CRDA: Error: [Errno 2] No such file or directory
>   Card hw:0 'V8237'/'VIA 8237 with ALC655 at 0xb000, irq 22'
> To manage notifications about this bug go to:
The instances of Loss of mouse are more frequent and often when I reboot the graphics are corrupt.
The mouse is fuzzy white lines and dots , some icons are colors smudged .
BTW , IF Internet radio is playing..
and loops with the same 1 second bite.
but it is as if all the CPU is being used when it Freezes or some other thing like that.
Anyone have any idea what this is ?
What changed in the update that would cause the Old issue to come back or is this a New Issue?
I am noting that the IMPORTANCE has not changed and it has not be assigned yet.
Any one going to take this up ?
I am sure I am not the only one.
Would it be possible for you to try an older version of the kernel, to see if the issue goes away?
Possible try: linux-image-2.6.35-22-generic_2.6.35-22.33_i386.deb which can be downloaded from:
I found and have now applied
06:32 755KI will watch and see if I have any further issues.
On Mon, Nov 7, 2011 at 12:56 PM, Joseph Salisbury <
> Would it be possible for you to try an older version of the kernel, to > see if the issue goes away?
> You received this bug notification because you are subscribed to the bug > report.
>  10.10 Kernel update black screen flash and no mouse
> Status in linux package in Ubuntu:
>  After the recent update to the kernel in 10 .10 I noticed that some times > my screen will flash black..
and then the mouse cursor disappears.
I am no > wiz in here..
so can't give a great deal of info on my system.
But the bug > fixes for such as this stopped last year.
>  I can reboot and find  the mouse again..
and I can move the mouse around > and find stuff , like using a tab key would be ..
but you can not see the > mouse.
tool bars end up with multi slurred > colors pix-elated.
a reboot and that is all better.
>  I am not one who knows how to update logs or find boot logs or the like..
> but if there is a beginner description on how to fix this..
>  AlsaVersion: Advanced Linux Sound Architecture Driver Version 1.0.23.
>  CRDA: Error: [Errno 2] No such file or directory
>   Card hw:0 'V8237'/'VIA 8237 with ALC655 at 0xb000, irq 22'
> To manage notifications about this bug go to:
so far going back  with the kernel 2.6.35-22.33_i386
However now my update manager keeps asking me to Update to the  Kernel 2.6.35-22.35 x86/x86_64
I hope that my information gives help to solve the issue in the newer Kernel..
as I can not trust the Update Manager  till the FIX is made.
Will some one get assigned to this soon ?
The mouse issue has returned as well.
and if music is playing , a  1 second loop in the hang.
I have just allowed my system to update the Kernel again to  2.6.35-22.35 x86/x86_64 via Update Manager's insistence.
Waiting to see if in this version the troubles still exist.
No one has answered in a while..
I took this part on my own.
If you wish I go back to the roll back version of Kernel 2.6.35-22.33_i386  ..
it exists in the upstream and
I hope some one will look this over soon.
who watches me on my system constantly..
and judges if  my system is so much better than his Buggy Windows system.
I can not see why he would even try to compete..
His is always issued and they don't HELP him like you all do for me.
with a safe system any day.
Make us all justified in our Faith in you..
that it cost nothing when you have a Great Team  who love the system.
the New Updated Kernel is worse.
Not only does it Freeze and Turn black..
but you can not just Blink in black and still see screen..
it full on Freezes so that you must use OFF button to reboot system.
Still waiting for some one to pay attention to this Bug.
is there something I should change above so that it is seen ?
um the fix release and release confirmed was a mistake while poking around the icons.
I think I messed that up.
SO far as I am aware and I am no Code wize..
my system is still messed up.
I am presently going back to the roll back kernel as suggested above..
The newest Update to the kernel is worse than it was before.
I went into synaptic and found the Linux headers that were New and Unintalled them there..
2.6.35-22.33 (linux-headers-2.6.35-22-generic) Will post notes on changes and if that helps the system..
may be when ya all chose to look into this..
you will see why the older one does less in corruption than the Newest ones.
No one has answered in a long while..
the results of my regression test are..
there are less Freezes , Black Screens , corruptions of video  or loss of mouse with the 20.6.35-22.33 than the newer Kernels and upstream modifications.
Still no one to do anything?
Someone like to assign this one?
try adding "clocksource=jiffies nolapic_timers" to the kernel command line parameter.
I see this is now a MEDIUM concern.
There was again another Kernel update..
I have allowed that and so far..
one day, I have no ill effects.
Will show it as a solve if they not show up or will post to show they are still there.
We see this New Kernel update by itself.
Had to put that back right away.
Reboot brought with it the Corruption.
Updated the Grub line again and rebooted..
We shall see how Newest Kernel Update does with the Jiffies comment in the Grub line.
Glad that this is now considered a Medium Concern..
Wish some one would work on it..
I feel like I am rambling out here.
Just trying to do the work as best I can on my own..
Hope it helps someone one some time.
now I am finding a Daily slow down of the system..
to the point of Freeze and Crash.
I also have noticed that as it begins to this..
the screen saver turns black and the response time to  and Key strike gets to the point of Nothing.
I have to force a reboot.
is this like the Ram thing from a year or so back ?
I think was 32.60 was very bad.
the Black Screens more often , Freezes , corruptions , Mouse disappearances..
I took it back , as suggested before, again  to the 20.6.35-22.33 regression.
I left in the grub change from above.
Things are acting more to normal.
I hope we can find a Full Solve here.
now there is a freeze and even a crash daily.
Even two or Three times a day.
I am having a hard time functioning on this system.
I am getting all the above Bells and Whistles..
I really don't want to back up and have to change OS's over this.
I like the 10.10 I am using.
I don't want to do Unity..
and I have installed Ubuntu for a few others..
and the Full install or upgrades to the 11 versions are clunky and controlling.
So far with no influence from me..
I have been asked to ROLL back to 10.10 on each one.
That is for a PAD not a PC.
Let me have my joy here in Ubuntu 10.10 until there is another option..
I am glad that someone raised it to Medium but can we Assign it ?
Newest update to kernel .63 did not fix issue either.
sudden blinking and then Black screen..
